arm_group.description: Celotres following surgical removal of earlobe keloid.

brief_summary.textblock:
The objective of the study is to actively gather additional information on safety, device
      performance and possible emergent risks following the use of Celotres in a post-market
      setting when used to reduce the recurrence rate, volume, appearance and/or symptoms
      associated with keloid scarring in subjects undergoing surgical excision of keloids as
      compared to the scientific literature.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Post Market Study Evaluating the Safety, Device Perfomance and Possible Emergent Risks of Celotres in Preventing Recurrence in Keloid Lesions Treated Adjunctive to Surgical Excision

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients electing to undergo keloid excision procedure

          -  Patients able and willing to give written informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients with a known or potential risk of allergy or sensitivity to products or
             substances containing porcine gelatin.

intervention.description: Celotres following surgical removal of earlobe keloid.

clinical_study.official_title: A Post Market Study Evaluating the Safety, Device Perfomance and Possible Emergent Risks of Celotres in Preventing Recurrence in Keloid LEsions Treated Adjunctive to suRgical Excision. PMCS: EURO-KLEAR

primary_outcome.description: Device safety is defined as the incidence of device related adverse events.
primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of device related adverse events
primary_outcome.time_frame: Assessed at treatment, suture removal, Months 1, 3, 6, 9 and 12

primary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects with recurrence of keloid scar post excision defined as the presence of scar tissue volume >0.3cc
primary_outcome.measure: Recurrence of keloid post scar excision

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient and Observer Scar Assessment Scale (POSAS)

secondary_outcome.description: Questions related to packaging integrity and successful administration of product as assessed by the Principal Investigator.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
